Authors:
Toshinori Matozaki, Tsutomu Hattori, Tomohiro Kuwahara,
Sophon Boonlue, Nitaro Maekawa, Akira Nakagiri, Kozue Sotome, Naoki
Endo
Title:
First report of Polyporus ciliatus in Japan, and taxonomic
re-evaluation of synonymous species described from Japan.
Keywords:
Lentinus, polypore, Taxonomy, Type specimens, Wood decay
fungi
Abstract:
Polyporus ciliatus (Polyporales, Basidiomycota) is
reported as a new record to Japan with a new Japanese name
(“Ezono-amisugi-take”) based on both morphological and phylogenetical
examinations of specimens from Hokkaido. Phylogenetic analyses revealed
that P. ciliatus collections from Japan, China and Denmark had the
identical nrLSU sequences and formed a distinct clade allying to P.
longiporus. Examinations of cultural characters revealed that P.
ciliatus produce subglobose to fusiform, rarely clavate chlamydospores.
We also re-evaluated the holotype of P. saitoi collected from Japan.
Polyporus saitoi has been treated as a synonym with P. ciliatus, but the
holotype has corky context, reddish brown pileus surface in drying
condition and larger pores [(3) 45 pores/mm] than in P. ciliatus, and is
morphologically distinct from P. ciliatus. We conclude that P. saitoi is
a dubious name because its holotype lacks microscopic characters besides
skeletal-binding hyphae is insufficient for species identification.
